heading: bormann stayed put
subheading: martin bormann, the most enigmatic member of the nazi heirarchy and one of the most powerful figures in the third reich, did not escape to south america in the closing days of world war ii after all. he died by his own hand in the ruins of berlin. although german authorities have believed this since tentatively identifying a body unearthed in 1972 as that of bormann, dna tests recently performed on the remains provided the conclusive proof, reuters reported sunday.
author: wired staff
